posts.content:
A few points about posting "finished" builds, D'Alessandro...

When you get a chance, please re-read the ECB rules so that all the builds you post will provide what is expected from these builds.

Out of the list, two issues stand out to me. First, a "tested" build... although thorough testing with a trainer may provide some credibility, nothing really is a substitute for in-game experience.

The preferred sequence should always be: DESIGN-PLAY-POST-DISCUSS-TWEAK-REVISE POST. Players/visitors prefer to consider builds which have already been proven to be effective before they invest their own time to further test it on their own.

Secondly, since this was designed specifically for one server, a Russian one, the most effective procedure would be to post it as a build in an "Axistown-only" thread in the Persistent World subforum or preface the build's title with the label "[Axistown]". It would not rule out the possibility of using it elsewhere, of course, but clearly describe its original intent. At least that way, other players seeking a design for the Axistown server will know that fact at a glance... and other readers will not be totally perplexed by the bizarre leveling schedule. I would also recommend providing a link in this build to the original topic (which describes many of the idiosyncrasies of designing for gaming on the Axistown server).

As for what has been documented above... note that this build combo only needs to be an "Any Lawful" alignment. Your choice of
Lawful-neutral is a personal preference which may imply some roleplaying bias on your part, but it is not a requirement to play the build unless dictated by Axistown, which should be explained further, if that is the case.

It is also EXTREMELY handy to provide both a Level 20 spell assignment list (once again, based on what was tested) PLUS the max post-buff stats (like AB, AC, HP, saves, APR, etc.) to illustrate the full potential of the finished build. I would recommend basing these stats on mundane equipment only so that "apples can be compared to other apples".
